description.narrative: (Zambia): Strengthening Agricultural and Environmental Policy in Zambia (SEAP), implemented by a local think tank, will develop and implement favorable agricultural and environmental policies to promote agricultural-led, environmentally-sustainable, broad-based economic growth, resulting in decreased poverty and hunger. With FY 2015 funding SEAP will conduct research jointly with the government on cross-cutting areas including agriculture, sustainable natural resource management, gender, resilience, adaptation and mitigation to climate change and nutrition. The project will promote evidence-based policy discussion, formulation and implementation and advocate for key policy changes across a broad group of stakeholders and government actors. The activity responds to Feed the Future and Global Climate Change goals and entrenches and indigenizes evidence-based decision-making.
